prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife → Babahlese Knife → Allebahstian Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis. [info] Someone in the Steel Samurai costume is pushing a pushcart into Babahl. There is a bulge in the pushcart.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: As I said earlier, I was assigned to guard duty in the Allebahstian Embassy.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 1
Testimony: After I saw the Steel Samurai off on his way towards the ambassador's office...
Person: Franziska
Testimony 2
Testimony: ...I returned to the rose garden for a bit, and checked up on the security situation.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 3
Testimony: After all the preparations were in place, I was called back by Ambassador Alba to his office.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 4
Testimony: When I arrived, Ambassador Alba was watering the flowers on the windowsill.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 5
Testimony: There were four large passionflowers in full bloom in the flower box.
Person: Franziska

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies provided. Let me start by looking through the testimonies and then cross-referencing the evidence.

The testimonies given are all from Franziska. Let me check each one:

Testimony 5 says there were four large passionflowers in full bloom in the flower box. Now, looking at the evidence list, Evidence 14 (Passionflowers) mentions that there are two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes care of them. So here's a contradiction. Franziska claims there were four, but the evidence states there are two. That seems like a direct contradiction. 

Wait, but I need to make sure there's no other possible evidence or testimony that might be conflicting. Let me check other testimonies. Testimony 4 mentions Alba was watering the flowers on the windowsill. The passionflowers are in a flower box, which might be on the windowsill. The evidence about the passionflowers (14) says two are in bloom, but Franziska testifies there were four. So this is a clear contradiction. 

No other testimonies here seem to clash with other evidence as directly. For example, the other testimonies about guard duty or checking security don't have obvious evidence contradicting them. The key here is the number of passionflowers. So the pair would be Evidence 14 and Testimony 5.

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants one pair where the evidence directly contradicts the testimony. Let's start by looking through the testimonies provided by Lang. There are four testimonies here, numbered 0 to 3 (I notice that the list shows Testimony 0 to 4, but Testimony 4 is from Lang as well, but maybe it's a typo in the numbering? Wait, the list shows Testimony 0 to 4, each with a person, all Lang. So five testimonies from Lang.

Looking at the content of these testimonies. Testimony 0 says that Babahl's statue was draped in Yatagarasu's clothes and shot over. Testimony 1 says that even if you fired arrows from this side, they wouldn't go far with a statue tied to them. Testimony 2 asks what the crossbow launched if not a statue. Testimony 3 states that the Primidux Statue didn't sprout wings. Testimony 4 is a comment about being a realist, which might be a challenge to the player's logic.

Now, the key is to find evidence that directly contradicts one of these statements. Let's check the evidence. Evidence 16 is Allebahst's Primidux Statue, which mentions that it was used as a weapon and was swapped with a fake. Evidence 25 is a photo of the Yatagarasu taken during the fire, which might relate to the Yatagarasu's Key (Evidence 4, which is a knife). 

Wait, Testimony 3 by Lang says "I don't think I need to tell you that the Primidux Statue didn't sprout wings." This seems to imply that the statue couldn't have moved on its own. However, Evidence 16 mentions that the Allebahst's Primidux Statue "was used as a weapon" and "has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon." Also, Evidence 16 states "Signs it was moved during murder." So if the statue was moved, perhaps via some mechanism, then Lang's testimony that it didn't sprout wings (i.e., move by itself) is contradicted by the evidence that it was moved. But how?

Wait, maybe the method of moving the statue is the key. Testimony 3 is about the statue not moving by itself, but the evidence shows that it was moved. So perhaps the method of movement (like using the crossbow arrows) is contradicted by another evidence. Wait, Testimony 2 asks what the crossbow launched if not a statue. The crossbow arrows are mentioned in Evidence 30, which are actually crossbow arrows. If the crossbow was used to launch something, but Lang is saying that arrows couldn't carry a statue. But perhaps the crossbow arrows were used to transport something else, like the knife or another item. Wait, Evidence 30: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows. They are actually crossbow arrows. The dirt on the tips might indicate they were used. If they were used to shoot something, maybe the statue was moved via another method, like the revolving fireplace (Evidence 29) or the wire (Evidence 28). 

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 0: Babahl's statue was draped in Yatagarasu's clothes and shot over. Evidence 25 is a photo of the Yatagarasu during the fire. But Evidence 25 is a photo taken after the fire, which might show the Yatagarasu's movements. Maybe the photo shows that the Yatagarasu was present, contradicting the idea that the statue was dressed as the Yatagarasu. Hmm, not sure. 

Wait, Evidence 16 says that the Allebahst's Primidux Statue was moved during the murder. So Lang's testimony 3 says the statue didn't sprout wings (i.e., couldn't move by itself), but the evidence shows it was moved. How was it moved? Evidence 28 is a wire found in Babahl's grandfather clock. Evidence 29 is the revolving fireplace wall, which might have been used to move the statue between the two countries. So the statue was moved via the revolving fireplace, not by being shot with arrows. Therefore, Lang's Testimony 3, which mocks the idea that the statue moved on its own, is contradicted by the evidence of the revolving fireplace (Evidence 29) and the moved statue (Evidence 16). But how does that directly contradict?

Alternatively, Testimony 1: Even if you fired arrows from this side, they wouldn't go far with a statue tied to them. But Evidence 30 is crossbow arrows. However, if the crossbow was used to shoot something else, like the knife (Evidence 4) or the key, then maybe. Hmm.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 0: "So Babahl's statue was draped in the Yatagarasu's clothes, and then shot over here?" This suggests that the statue was shot across, perhaps via crossbow. But Evidence 16 says that Allebahst's statue (originally from Babahl's secretariat's office) was moved. If the statue was moved through the revolving fireplace (Evidence 29), then it wasn't shot over. So Lang's Testimony 0 (about shooting the statue) is contradicted by Evidence 29 (revolving fireplace used to move it). But which testimony number is that? Testimony 0 is the first one. So the contradiction would be between Evidence 29 (revolving fireplace used) and Testimony 0's assertion that it was shot over. But the evidence shows that the statue was moved via the revolving wall, not shot with arrows. Therefore, that would be a contradiction. Alternatively, if the evidence shows that the statue was moved via the fireplace, then the testimony about it being shot over is wrong.

Another angle: Testimony 2 is Lang asking, "If it wasn't a statue that was tied to the arrows, then what did the crossbow launch...?" If there's evidence that the crossbow launched something else. Evidence 30's crossbow arrows, but what were they used for? Maybe the arrows were used to launch the Yatagarasu's Key (Evidence 4, a knife), which was the murder weapon. But how does that relate?

Alternatively, Evidence 16 mentions that the Allebahst's Primidux Statue was used as a weapon, which might have been the murder weapon. If the crossbow arrows (Evidence 30) were used in a way that doesn't involve moving the statue, but the statue was moved via another method, then Testimony 2's implication that the crossbow was used to launch the statue is contradicted by evidence showing the statue was moved via the fireplace. So maybe Testimony 0 or 2 is contradicted by Evidence 29 (revolving fireplace) or Evidence 16 (statue moved during murder).

But wait, checking the evidence list again: Evidence 29 is "Revolving Fireplace Wall: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used." This would allow moving the statue between the two embassies without shooting it. So Lang's Testimony 0 suggests the statue was shot over, but Evidence 29 shows that it was moved through the fireplace. Hence, contradiction.

Therefore, the answer should be {"evidence": 29, "testimony": 0}.

Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge

Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.

Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue

Kay:
Then you mean, Ambassador Alba is the real killer? But I thought the two of them were friends?
Edgeworth:

Kay:

Edgeworth:

Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24

Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26

Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis. [info] Someone in the Steel Samurai costume is pushing a pushcart into Babahl. There is a bulge in the pushcart.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Frankly, I still don't understand why I am being placed under suspicion here.
Person: Alba
Testimony 1
Testimony: Under your hypothetical scenario, Mr. Coachen and I were fellow smugglers.
Person: Alba
Testimony 2
Testimony: In that case, what motive would I have had to kill my co-conspirator?
Person: Alba
Testimony 3
Testimony: But to get to the point, I was in Allebahst the whole time.
Person: Alba
Testimony 4
Testimony: So, it's simply not possible for me to have killed him in Babahl. That is my alibi.
Person: Alba

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. The user wants to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other, specifically involving Ambassador Alba's testimonies.

First, let's look at Alba's testimonies. Testimony 3 says he was in Allebahst the whole time, and Testimony 4 claims that makes it impossible for him to kill Coachen in Babahl. So his alibi is that he couldn't have been in Babahl during the murder.

Now, I need to check the evidence list for something that places him in Babahl or shows he could move between the two countries. Let's go through the evidence:

Evidence 1: Embassy Guide mentions two countries sharing the building with borders. Maybe the embassies are connected? But how does that relate to Alba's presence?

Evidence 29: Revolving Fireplace Wall in Babahl's side has been used. If there's a revolving wall, maybe there's a secret passage between the two embassies? That would allow someone from Allebahst to access Babahl without being detected.

Evidence 36: Security footage shows someone in a Steel Samurai costume pushing a pushcart into Babahl with a bulge. If Alba used a disguise or someone else moved the body, but not directly related to his alibi.

Evidence 37: Pushcart with blood inside, but again, not directly showing Alba's movement.

Wait, Evidence 29 is key here. If the revolving fireplace wall was used, then someone from Allebahst (like Alba) could have rotated the wall to enter Babahl, commit the murder, and return. That would mean his claim of being in Allebahst the whole time is technically true, but he could still have accessed Babahl through the secret passage. Therefore, Evidence 29 contradicts Testimony 3 and 4 because it provides a way for him to be in both places despite his alibi.

So the contradiction is between Alba's Testimony 3 (being in Allebahst the whole time) and Evidence 29 (Revolving Fireplace Wall used), which implies he could have moved between embassies.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. So, we need to find which evidence contradicts one of Alba's testimonies. Let's start by looking at Alba's testimonies.

Testimony 0: He claims he killed Coachen in the theater with a knife from his bouquet.
Testimony 1: He says he left the bouquet there, so anyone could have taken the knife.
Testimony 2: He points out that Coachen's body was found in Babahl.
Testimony 3: He argues there's no way he could have moved the body from the theater to Babahl.

Now, the key contradiction here is probably about the body's location and how it got there. Let's check the evidence. Evidence 36 is the security footage showing someone in a Steel Samurai costume pushing a pushcart into Babahl with a bulge. Evidence 37 mentions the pushcart had blood inside. So if the pushcart was used to transport the body, then Alba's testimony 3 about not being able to move the body is contradicted by this evidence. Because the pushcart could have been used to move the body from the theater to Babahl, which is possible given the shared embassy building with borders mentioned in Evidence 1. The evidence shows that the body could have been transported using the pushcart, thus contradicting Alba's claim that it was impossible.

Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.

Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I watched from the last row. The stage was well-lit, but it was dark out in the audience.
Person: Alba
Testimony 1
Testimony: I swear I was there in the audience, but it's hard to prove that, I suppose.
Person: Alba
Testimony 2
Testimony: I do remember the contents of the show very well, though. Is that proof enough for you?
Person: Alba
Testimony 3
Testimony: One of the scenes was of his never-before-seen "Early Summer Rain Jab" move.
Person: Alba
Testimony 4
Testimony: Those moving scenes were seared into this old man's heart. I'll never forget them.
Person: Alba

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. The user wants one pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony. Let's start by looking through the testimonies and cross-referencing them with the evidence.

First, the testimonies are all from Alba. Let's list them out:

Testimony 0: Alba says he watched from the last row. The stage was well-lit, but the audience was dark.
Testimony 1: He claims he was in the audience but admits it's hard to prove.
Testimony 2: He remembers the show's contents well and asks if that's proof.
Testimony 3: He mentions a scene with the "Early Summer Rain Jab" move.
Testimony 4: He says the moving scenes are unforgettable.

Now, looking at the evidence related to the Steel Samurai's performance. Evidence 15 is the Samurai Spear, which is bent and hollow. The testimony about the "Early Summer Rain Jab" (Testimony 3) says that the move was performed. But according to Evidence 15, Larry couldn't perform that move because the spear was bent. So if the spear was bent before the show, then the move couldn't have been executed as described. Therefore, Alba's testimony about seeing the move is contradicted by the evidence that the spear was damaged, making the move impossible. That seems like a solid contradiction.
